should not be exclusively designed for children,
but should include the adult world as well. Such
exposure deepens the appreciation of education as
a total experience, rather than as a fragmented
one. The parent, in other words, who has some
insights into the problem-solving experiences of
their children can be of meaningful help to the
child, because he has not been excluded from
those experiences. This kind of involvement can
be of significant importance in the unification
of the family group.
"SOME VOICES OF WATTS"
Though localized, this program idea is related to
one of the most fruitful program efforts which
was initiated soon after the riots in Watts (Los
Angeles) in August of last year. This program
series could present the works of the Watts Writers
Group, organized under the direction and guidance
of Mr. Budd Schulberg, and now housed in an entity
known as "Douglas House". This has become a center
for writers-in-residence. This series could take
many forms: Poetry Readings... Short Story Read*-
